Posts.Content: rngdbdy wrote: I have been lurking on this site for several weeks and thought I would go ahead and stop creepin.  I just have to say that I think this is a wonderful site for people to connect--with questions, concerns, fears, experience, hope, and whatever else.  A little info about me:  I am soon to be 48, have been on estrogen for 17 years (had a total hysterectomy when I was 30 due to severe and unrelenting endometriosis), have one child, and an unknown history of breast cancer in my maternal side of the family (mom died when I was 24 and her mother had a lumpectomy for some reason unknown and she is deceased as well from old age).  My father has had prostate cancer and malignant melanoma in the past though.  So here is why I am frustrated.  Several years ago I started having some discomfort in my left breast around the 9 o'clock area but no lump felt.  Had mammo, dx mammo, and because of some suspicious findings, did spot compression with US which ended up showing clear.  I have had my mammos pretty consistently and have had US on this same area a few times, all clear.  I have "exceedingly dense" breast tissue and fibrocystic changes for as long as I can remember.  Pan stage left to the present.  About 9 months ago, this tender area has become very tender and painful, there is a palpable thickening (lump?) that is the exact focus of the pain; PCP could feel it as well.  Had dx mammo and US and radiologist told me "it's probably just some breast tissue that has thickened" and when I asked him if this could cause increasing discomfort over the course of a few years, he said it could and that I had nothing to worry about, Bi-Rads 2 rating.  The upper outside of this breast has become full and firm and tender over the last year (and the right breast is nothing like this), I mean I can grab the firm full part with my hand and it's the size of a golf ball at least.  And I have this feeling about it.  I don't feel impending doom and I don't feel panicky or scared but I have this knowing type feeling and I just want to deal with whatever it is.  I'm having a heck of a time getting an MRI and feel like I should just go find a BS on my own and see what I can accomplish.  If it's a lipoma or something, that's fine but let's get rid of it because it's painful.  I feel like I am at the mercy of people that are not living in my shoes.  Thanks for letting me vent and for being a part of this forum, if nothing else, because I haven't said anything to anyone (except here) that I feel so sure about what this is.  So thanks.  And, did anyone else feel like they just "knew" something wasn't right? Cheryl Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: A little more than frustrated rngdbdy DigitalCowgirl

Posts.Content: Dec 21, 2012 09:25PM rngdbdy wrote: Thank you all for your responses.  I have not had a biopsy yet as the latest MD wants to do the MRI first.  And I guess I will keep that appointment as it is more definitive for dense tissue as the other tests.  I think that I just hate feeling like I'm a whiner and complainer.  Also, I don't normally feel so much ambigouity and confusion with my intuition--which is why I'm doubting it I guess.  I had extremely severe bilateral mastitis 23 years ago--so bad that the skin was splitting and oozing--and I have often wondered if that along with fibrocystic tissue, and density could have an influence on my level of risk.  I venture that it doesn't really matter at this point though.  I just really don't want to have to continue holding my left breast if I go up and down the stairs too quickly to keep it from hurting so much.  I am hoping that they can tell me the MRI results that day.  Again, thank you all. Cheryl
Posts.Title: questioning my sanity! rngdbdy rngdbdy

Posts.Content: rngdbdy wrote: I have a quick question for the experienced members--before your bc diagnosis, how often (if ever) did any of you experience that gnawing knowing feeling in your gut yet it turn out to be a false alarm due to (1) the test not showing anything or (2) the results coming back b9?  I feel like I am going insane to a certain extent.  Yes, I have had changes in my left breast (increase in size, 1 lump with increase in pain over the last year and 1 mass that has presented in the last 5 months, general achiness and sharp pain in that breast, nipple changes, all these big veins showing in the last few months).  I have "exceedingly dense" tissue and fibrocystic breasts, but this feels different from the norm even though mammos and u/s show nothing--not even the palpable masses that the docs can feel.  I've had this "knowing" feeling in my gut (I'm generally pretty intuitive) but my husband thinks I'm making a big deal out of nothing and the docs I've seen so far (except my GP who has been supportive all along the way) have left me with the impression that I'm concerned over normal changes and that's all there is to it--but these changes are not normal for me.  I've basically had to force my way to get any test that I have had done so far (with the help of my GP).  It has made me really question myself and now I'm wondering if I should just drop pursuit of anything else.  I have an MRI scheduled for 12/31 and am considering cancelling that.  Honestly, I'm feeling very self-conscious that maybe I'm just creating a problem that's not there.  And this gut feeling is driving me nuts and I wonder if I'm creating that as well!  Honestly, I don't feel scared or anything but more of a just wanting to know.  So, how many of you have had this experience of your intuition betraying you?  I appreciate any feedback that is offered and thank you! Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: questioning my sanity! rngdbdy rngdbdy
